intro: Psychotria tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with a distinctive calyx that resembles a crown. Psychotria tenuicaulis is also known for its association with certain species of epiphytic fungi and its role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
